content:
Examples of cross-sectional study designs:

1. A study examining the prevalence of obesity among adults in a particular country by randomly selecting a sample of adults and measuring their body mass index (BMI).
2. A study comparing the prevalence of mental health disorders among different age groups in a particular community by surveying a sample of individuals from each age group.

Examples of longitudinal study designs:

1. A study examining the long-term effects of a particular medication on a group of patients with a specific medical condition by following them over several years and measuring their symptoms, side effects, and quality of life.
2. A study investigating the development of language skills in children from different socioeconomic backgrounds by following them from infancy to early childhood and measuring their language abilities at different ages.
